alert.note: Alert for Chemung; Schuyler; Seneca; Southern Cayuga; Steuben; Yates (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:41PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Seneca, Schuyler, Yates, southwestern Cayuga, northwestern Chemung and central Steuben Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Benton to near Cameron. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Corning, Bath, Penn Yan, Hector, Romulus, Fayette, Starkey, Campbell, Benton and Urbana. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 37 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chemung; Schuyler; Seneca; Southern Cayuga; Steuben; Yates
